messages.message:
> Can you help with the egress services from search-tservice
hi @sada - you will be able to find the egress from search-service (ex: elasticsearch) or others by inspecting the deployment template. Let us know if you need help. @shikhar @Xi Cheng can also help you with it
Oh okay. Let me try doing that. Thanks @sudeep

> Regarding rabbitmq port epdm(4369), I
all services use port 5672 to connect to rabbitmq. nginx uses 15672 for console as well. And prometheus uses 15692 for stats
you can find these in the deployment templates as well

```all services use port 5672 to connect to rabbitmq. nginx uses 15672 for console as well. And prometheus uses 15692 for stats```
In that case I'll remove the other ports.
yeah for nginx and prometheus you will need the other ports mentioned here

fyi @Sabyasachi Roy this is the PR for the sheet
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1641483504004700

Have created a separate sheet (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y2N5shY6oBzJaf5AikwsUsSQWUlcxhjS5dputBlND74/edit?usp=sharing) for release-22.01 as there's inclusion of core-platform-service in place of 3 thrift services. Will be incorporating @sudeepâ€™s comments into both the sheets soon.

Thanks for the review comments @sudeep, @shikhar and @Sabyasachi Roy, I have accommodated the changes in Network Policies (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19ai7ZJxfGRT176Uay7bwdcY68KbCCR9mH9R5Nuyva4w/edit#gid=1675500677) & Network Policies 22.01 (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y2N5shY6oBzJaf5AikwsUsSQWUlcxhjS5dputBlND74/edit#gid=1675500677) as well as the PR (https://github.com/instabase/deployments/pull/732). Please have a look and let me know of any changes.
@sada: I think I missed core-platform-service in another couple of places. But the excel sheet doesnt seem to be editable anymore (monitoring tab) for example
@Sabyasachi Roy please drop a comment so that I can add wherever it's missing. Thanks.
No wait. Something happened. I made all the changes to add core-platform-services to that sheet. Did so about 4 hours ago. All of them are missing now.

Can you check this sheet ? https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y2N5shY6oBzJaf5AikwsUsSQWUlcxhjS5dputBlND74/edit#gid=1675500677 (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Y2N5shY6oBzJaf5AikwsUsSQWUlcxhjS5dputBlND74/edit#gid=1675500677) 
This has your changes I believe
Ok. So as long as this one has it, I don't need to do anything else right?
Correct. Unless something is missing please let me know
I think for core-platform-services, that last excel sheet you linked above should be good to go. But I will let you know if I find something missing..
